title: Aminu Jibrin Aliyu
text:
My name is Aminu Jibrin Aliyu, and I am an Electrical and Electronics Engineer dedicated to advancing power systems stability, renewable energy integration, and advanced control strategies. My work focuses on developing innovative solutions to enhance energy efficiency, reliability, and sustainability in modern power systems.
This website serves as a platform to showcase my research, publications, and professional journey—from my academic background in Electrical Engineering to my ongoing PhD research at Universiti Teknologi PETRONAS. My expertise spans power electronics, grid-forming inverters, and MATLAB simulations, with a strong emphasis on bridging the gap between academia and industry.
Beyond research, I am actively involved in mentorship and knowledge sharing, serving as a University and College Liaison Officer at the Zeribe Nwosu Foundation (ZNF) and a Newsletter Editor for the IEEE Universiti Teknologi PETRONAS Student Branch. Through these roles, I contribute to educational initiatives, career mentorship, and the dissemination of technical knowledge.
I invite you to explore my projects, publications, and professional engagements to learn more about my commitment to driving innovation in electrical and power engineering.

title: About Me
text:
Aminu Jibrin Aliyu is a dedicated researcher and educator in Electrical and Electronics Engineering, currently pursuing his PhD at Universiti Teknologi PETRONAS under the guidance of Ts. Dr. Ramani Kannan and Ts. Dr. Ho Tatt Wei. He earned his M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering from Ahmadu Bello University, Nigeria, in 2021, focusing his thesis on developing an optimal control strategy for active power filters using delta-connected cascaded H-bridges. Prior to that, he graduated with first-class honors in Electrical Engineering from the same institution in 2017, where he analyzed system collapse incidences on the Nigerian power system for his final year project.
Since December 2021, Aminu has been serving as a Lecturer II at Ahmadu Bello University, engaging in teaching, lab demonstrations, and student supervision. His research interests include power systems stability, renewable energy integration, and advanced control strategies. He has contributed to several peer-reviewed journals and conferences, including publications in the Savannah Journal of Science and Engineering Technology and presentations at the IEEE International Conference on Power and Energy.
Aminu is proficient in simulation software such as PSIM, MATLAB/SIMULINK, and PSpice, and has experience with Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) devices like Typhoon HIL. He is a member of professional organizations including IEEE, the Nigerian Society of Engineers, the International Association of Engineers (IAENG), and the Energy Institute (EI). In recognition of his academic excellence, he was awarded the Petroleum Trust Development Fund (PTDF) Overseas Scholarship in 2023.
Beyond his professional pursuits, Aminu is fluent in English and Hausa, and enjoys engaging in activities that bridge the gap between academia and industry. He is committed to advancing the field of electrical engineering through innovative research and dedicated teaching.

title: About Me
text:
Volunteer Work
Aminu Jibrin Aliyu is passionate about education and professional development, actively engaging in volunteer work to support learning and career advancement.
He serves as the University and College Liaison Officer for the Zeribe Nwosu Foundation (ZNF), a role he has held since January 2023. In this capacity, he helps advance education at all levels by organizing seminars, mentorship programs, and scholarship initiatives that empower students and young professionals to access career opportunities.
Additionally, Aminu contributes to the IEEE Universiti Teknologi PETRONAS (UTP) Student Branch as a Newsletter Editor since March 2024. Through this role, he plays a key part in disseminating important updates, research highlights, and industry insights to the IEEE student community.
His commitment to mentorship and academic outreach reflects his dedication to fostering the next generation of engineers and researchers.
